unnormalised: ## Return Policies: A Saga More Dramatic Than a Daily Soap on Star Plus
normalised: Hashtag Return Policies: A Saga More Dramatic Than a Daily Soap on Star Plus

unnormalised: Let's be honest, folks. Navigating return policies in the retail world can feel like trying to find a decent parking spot in Chandni Chowk on Diwali - utterly chaotic and slightly terrifying. You buy that gorgeous kurta online from Myntra, envisioning yourself looking like Deepika Padukone at a wedding, only to discover it fits more like a potato sack. Now, the fun begins.
normalised: Let's be honest, folks. Navigating return policies in the retail world can feel like trying to find a decent parking spot in Chandni Chowk on Diwali - utterly chaotic and slightly terrifying. You buy that gorgeous kurta online from Myntra, envisioning yourself looking like Deepika Padukone at a wedding, only to discover it fits more like a potato sack. Now, the fun begins.

unnormalised: Each retailer seems to have crafted their return policy with the sole intention of confusing even the most seasoned shopper. Is it 7 days? 15 days? Does it depend on the phase of the moon? Is there a secret handshake involved?
normalised: Each retailer seems to have crafted their return policy with the sole intention of confusing even the most seasoned shopper. Is it seven days? fifteen days? Does it depend on the phase of the moon? Is there a secret handshake involved?

unnormalised: Remember that time I bought that "genuine leather" belt from a vendor at the Pushkar Camel Fair on 26/01/2023? Turns out "genuine leather" meant "genuine plastic imitation of leather that cracks after three uses". Trying to return *that* was a comedy of errors. The vendor just shrugged and offered me chai. Lesson learned: Pushkar vendors and return policies are not bosom buddies.
normalised: Remember that time I bought that "genuine leather" belt from a vendor at the Pushkar Camel Fair on twenty sixth january two thousand and twenty three? Turns out "genuine leather" meant "genuine plastic imitation of leather that cracks after three uses". Trying to return that was a comedy of errors. The vendor just shrugged and offered me chai. Lesson learned: Pushkar vendors and return policies are not bosom buddies.

unnormalised: And don't even get me started on electronics! You finally upgrade to that fancy new phone at Croma after months of saving, only to find out the camera blurs everything unless you’re shooting at 03:00 AM. Now you have to wrestle with the return policy, provide blood samples (okay, maybe not, but it feels like it), and explain why you, a perfectly sane individual, want to return a phone that apparently only takes good photos when ghosts are awake.
normalised: And don't even get me started on electronics! You finally upgrade to that fancy new phone at Croma after months of saving, only to find out the camera blurs everything unless you’re shooting at zero three hundred A M. Now you have to wrestle with the return policy, provide blood samples (okay, maybe not, but it feels like it), and explain why you, a perfectly sane individual, want to return a phone that apparently only takes good photos when ghosts are awake.

unnormalised: The key, my friends, is to read the fine print. ALL of it. Before you click "Add to Cart," scan that return policy like your future depends on it. Is there a restocking fee? Do you need the original packaging, even if your dog decided it was a chew toy? Can you return it in person, or are you stuck navigating the labyrinthine world of return shipping labels and waiting in line at the post office at 10:00 hrs sharp?
normalised: The key, my friends, is to read the fine print. ALL of it. Before you click "Add to Cart," scan that return policy like your future depends on it. Is there a restocking fee? Do you need the original packaging, even if your dog decided it was a chew toy? Can you return it in person, or are you stuck navigating the labyrinthine world of return shipping labels and waiting in line at the post office at ten hundred hours sharp?

unnormalised: So, the next time you're faced with a return, channel your inner Amitabh Bachchan, stand tall, and remember: you have rights, dammit! Just maybe, keep a backup plan of chai and biscuits, just in case the return process drags on longer than a K serial. May the odds (and the return policy) be ever in your favor.
normalised: So, the next time you're faced with a return, channel your inner Amitabh Bachchan, stand tall, and remember: you have rights, dammit! Just maybe, keep a backup plan of chai and biscuits, just in case the return process drags on longer than a K serial. May the odds (and the return policy) be ever in your favor.
